serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/ft/attempt_count
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The number of times CMS will attempt to recover from a connection failure. The default value is 0, which denotes that CMS will keep attempting to recover until all connections are restored, or until CIS is shut down.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/ft/attempt_delay
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The delay, in milliseconds, between CMS' attempts to recover from a connection failure. The default value is 1000.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/ft/message_handling/onErrorProcedure
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The name of the procedure to call in case of receiving an invalid message. The procedure must accept three arguments, a string value for the error, a string value for the offending message, and a timestamp for the time at which the error was reported.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/ft/message_handling/stopOnError
serverAttributeDef.annotation: CMS will always abort on receiving GG messages that have an invalid message structure (e.g. missing required elements or attributes). This flag specifies whether CMS will also abort if any other kind of errors are detected on a GG message (e.g. improperly formatted data values).

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/cisManagedDestinations
serverAttributeDef.annotation: True if the lifecycle (creation, deletion) of required topics and queues should be managed by CIS; otherwise, false. If set to true, only the Internal EMS > Queue Connector setting is required to be specified. If set to false, all Internal EMS settings should be specified.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/input/defaultConnector
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The default connector pointing to the EMS server hosting inbound topics used to receive change notification messages.

Optional.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/internal/connector
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The connector pointing to the EMS server hosting the in-transit event queue maintained for fault-tolerance purposes. If CIS-Managed Destinations is set to true, the EMS server pointed to by this connector will also host the transient cache buffers used during the initialization of incrementally maintained caches.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/internal/inTransitEventQueue
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The name of the queue to be used as the in-transit event queue.

Applicable when CIS-Managed Destinations is set to false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/internal/topicConnector
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The connector pointing to the EMS server hosting the transient cache buffers used during the initialization of incrementally maintained caches.

Applicable when CIS-Managed Destinations is set to false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/internal/transientCacheBuffersTopic
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The name of the topic hosting the transient cache buffers used during the initialization of incrementally maintained caches.

Applicable when CIS-Managed Destinations is set to false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/output/defaultConnector
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The default connector pointing to the EMS server hosting outbound topics used to transmit change notification messages.

Optional.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/output/domain
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The name of the domain containing users and groups shared across CIS and the outbound EMS servers.

Optional.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/vendor/tibco/connAttemptCount
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the number of attempts that will be made to connect to the JMS server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/vendor/tibco/connAttemptDelay
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets a pause duration (in milliseconds) before the connection to the JMS server will be attempted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/vendor/tibco/connAttemptTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the duration (in milliseconds) after which a connection attempt fails.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/vendor/tibco/reconnAttemptCount
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the number of attempts that will be made to reconnect to the JMS server before failing the connection.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/vendor/tibco/reconnAttemptDelay
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the duration (in milliseconds) to pause before attempting to reconnect ot the JMS server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/messaging/vendor/tibco/reconnAttemptTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the duration (in milliseconds) after which a reconnection attempt fails.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/started
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This value denotes whether CMS is started or stopped. It should not be modified. Instead, cms_admin_start and cms_admin_stop should be used to start or stop CMS.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/subscription/expiration
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The number of hours a client subscription to monitor a resource for changes will remain valid.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/central/subscription/store
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The CIS resource path name that points to a relational data source container (e.g. schema) that should be used to host the subscription table (cis_cms_appl_subs) created and maintained by CMS.

Required.

This operation triggers a reintrospection that occurs as a background process. Depending on the contents of the datasource, this process may take some time. Before shutting down or else proceeding with subsequent operations, it is best to wait until the table CIS_CMS_APPL_SUBS is present in the selected datasource. (Use the 'refresh' button as necessary to update Studio's display of the server's metadata.)

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/ft/attempt_count
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This value denotes the number of times CMS will attempt to recover from a connection failure. The default value is 0, which denotes that CMS will keep attempting to recover until all connections are restored, or until CIS is shut down.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/ft/attempt_delay
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This value denotes the delay, in milliseconds, between CMS' attempts to recover from a connection failure. The default value is 1000.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/cisManagedDestinations
serverAttributeDef.annotation: True if the lifecycle (creation, deletion) of required topics and queues should be managed by CIS; otherwise, false. If set to true, only the Internal EMS > Queue Connector setting is required to be specified. If set to false, Internal EMS settings > Topic Connector and Internal EMS settings > Transient Cache Buffering Topic should be specified.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/internal/connector
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The connector pointing to the EMS server hosting the transient cache buffers used during the initialization of incrementally maintained caches.

Applicable when CIS-Managed Destinations is set to true.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/internal/topicConnector
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The connector pointing to the EMS server hosting the transient cache buffers used during the initialization of incrementally maintained caches.

Applicable when CIS-Managed Destinations is set to false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/internal/transientCacheBuffersTopic
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The name of the topic hosting the transient cache buffers used during the initialization of incrementally maintained caches.

Applicable when CIS-Managed Destinations is set to false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/output/defaultConnector
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The default connector pointing to the EMS server hosting outbound topics used to transmit change notification messages.

Optional.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/output/domain
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The name of the domain containing users and groups shared across CIS and the outbound EMS servers.

Optional.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/vendor/tibco/connAttemptCount
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the number of attempts that will be made to connect to the JMS server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/vendor/tibco/connAttemptDelay
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets a pause duration (in milliseconds) before the connection to the JMS server will be attempted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/vendor/tibco/connAttemptTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the duration (in milliseconds) after which a connection attempt fails.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/vendor/tibco/reconnAttemptCount
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the number of attempts that will be made to reconnect to the JMS server before failing the connection.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/vendor/tibco/reconnAttemptDelay
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the duration (in milliseconds) to pause before attempting to reconnect ot the JMS server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/messaging/vendor/tibco/reconnAttemptTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Optional. Sets the duration (in milliseconds) after which a reconnection attempt fails.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/started
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This value denotes whether CMS is started or stopped. It should not be modified. Instead, cms_admin_start and cms_admin_stop should be used to start or stop CMS.

serverAttributeDef.name: /cms/edge/subscription/store
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The CIS resource path name that points to a relational data source container (e.g. schema) that should be used to host the subscription table (cis_cms_appl_subs) created and maintained by CMS.

Required.

This operation triggers a reintrospection that occurs as a background process. Depending on the contents of the datasource, this process may take some time. Before shutting down or else proceeding with subsequent operations, it is best to wait until the table CIS_CMS_APPL_SUBS is present in the selected datasource. (Use the 'refresh' button as necessary to update Studio's display of the server's metadata.)

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/index/caseSensitive
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If 'false', then the Discovery Server will ignore case differences during indexing and relationship discovery. Otherwise, it will take case differences into account during indexing and relationship discovery.

Discovery case sensitivity setting can only be changed after removing all Discovery indexes, relationships and tasks from the Discovery Tasks Panel in Composite Studio.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/index/dataObjectAnalysisSampleSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If Discovery Data Domain detection is enabled, we will analyze the data according to this sample size. Even if the number of entries in a column is less than this sample size all data in the column will be indexed. The minimum allowable value is 16.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/index/enableDataObjectDetection
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If 'false', then the Discovery Server will ignore Data Domain patterns during indexing and relationship discovery. Otherwise, it will take Data Domain patterns into account during indexing and relationship discovery. Note that you need to create or load Data Domain patterns or there won't be any effect on indexing by enabling this.

This setting can only be modified after removing all Discovery indexes and tasks from the Discovery Tasks Panel in Composite Studio.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/index/indexDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The directory to use for storing indexes.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/index/indexOnViews
serverAttributeDef.annotation: For Oracle data sources only, specifies whether any native Oracle views are indexed. By default, set to False. If set to True, the native Oracle views are indexed. Note that indexing will take more time when this is enabled.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/index/maximumConcurrentTasks
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The maximum number of tasks that may run concurrently. The maximum allowable value is 40.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/index/samplingIsEnabled
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Enable sampling to increase index speed, but this will lose some accuracy.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/index/samplingSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If sampling is enabled, we will sample data according to this specified size. If the number of entries in a column is less than this sampling size, then all data in the column will be indexed. The minimum allowable value is 10000.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/multicolumnkey/allowMultiColumnKey
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', then the Discovery Relationship Scanner will search for Multicolumn key. The maximum columns to be used to form a Multicolumn key is set in Maximum Columns for Multicolumn Key. Otherwise, it will only search for single column relationship.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/multicolumnkey/checkOnlyManyToMany
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', then the Multicolumn keys are only composed from many_to_many relationships. By doing this, it intuitively removes some combinations to form a Multicolumn key.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/multicolumnkey/consolidateHighlyRelatedMultiColumnKey
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Multicolumn relationships between two tables with score over 95 will be consolidated into one relationship if there are more than 5 Multicolumn relationships. The number of columns in Multicolumn key might be greater than what you set in Maximum Columns for Multicolumn Key.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/multicolumnkey/maximumColumnsForMultiColumnKey
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The maximum number of columns for creating a Multicolumn key. This value is used if Allow Multicolumn Key is true. This value can only be greater than or equal to 2. If you select Combine Multicolumn Relationships to be true, the number of columns in your Multicolumn key might be greater than what you set here.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/multicolumnkey/maximumKeysToBeCheckedForMultiColumnKey
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The maximum number of keys to check for possible Multicolumn keys between two tables. This value is used if Allow Multicolumn Key is true. If this value is large, it checks more combination of Multicolumn keys. However, it might run out of memory more easily.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Maximum Keys to Check Between Two Tables for Multicolumn Key

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/scoreMinimum
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The threshold score above which a relationship is created, in the range from 0 to 100.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/uniquePercentageMinimum
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The threshold percentage above which a column is considered to contain a unique set of values, in the range from 0 to 100.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/useDiscoveryRelationshipsInViewEditor
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', then if a table is added or dragged into the Composite Studio View Editor, it will show the discovered relationships from this table to all the other tables in the view and lets the user decide whether to use any of the identified relationships.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Use Discovery Relationships in View Editor

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/weightForColumnName
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The percentage weight assigned to column name comparison. For best results the 5 weights should total up to 100.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/weightForIndexKey
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The percentage weight assigned for column index keys. For best results the 5 weights should total up to 100.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/weightForMatchPercentage
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The percentage weight assigned to the number of column matches as a percentage of the number of distinct items. For best results the 5 weights should total up to 100.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/weightForNumberOfMatches
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The percentage weight assigned to the absolute number of column matches. For best results the 5 weights should total up to 100.

serverAttributeDef.name: /discovery/relationship/weightForSchemaLocality
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The percentage weight assigned to column locality within the schema. For best results the 5 weights should total up to 100.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/client/connection/allowRecentUserNames
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If true, then users of the Monitor Client will be provided the option to save their user and domain history when logging in. This history is only cached in the browser. If this option is set to false, any existing history will be erased the next time the browser connects to the Composite Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/client/connection/allowRememberPassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If true, then users of the Monitor Client will be provided the option to save their password history when logging in. This history is only cached in the browser. If this option is set to false, any existing history will be erased the next time the browser connects to the Composite Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/client/connection/requireSSL
serverAttributeDef.annotation: When true, the monitor client will only connect using https. It is recommended that this be set to true for production installations.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/enabled
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If 'true', then all available CIS data and events will be pushed to any listening monitor server.

When 'false', all data collection will be disabled.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/batchSendPeriodMs
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The period, in milliseconds, between pushes of CIS Events from the CIS Collector to Monitor Server (minimum is 100ms).

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableCacheEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Cache event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableCacheRefreshEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Cache Refresh event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableClusterEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Cluster event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableDataSourceConnectionEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Data Source Connection event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableDataSourceEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Data Source event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableDataSourceIntrospectEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Data Source Introspect event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableDataSourceStatsEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Data Source Statistics Processing event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableDataSourceTestEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Data Source Test event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enablePreparedStatementEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Prepared Statement event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableRequestEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Request event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableRequestWaitQueueThresholdEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Request Wait Queue Threshold event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableResourceEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Resource event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableResourceStatsEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Resource Statistics Processing event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableSecurityEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Security event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableSessionEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Session event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableSessionLoginEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Session Login event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableStorageEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Storage event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableTransactionEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Transaction event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableTriggerEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Trigger event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/cis/enableUserEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the User event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/daemon/enableDaemonEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Daemon will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Daemon event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/daemon/enableRepositoryEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Daemon will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Repository event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/daemon/enableServerEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Daemon will periodically collect and send CIS Events belonging to the Server event family to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/event/enable
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Events to a connected Monitor Server.

This setting will have no effect if Enable Data Collection is 'false'.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/resource/batchSendPeriodMs
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The period, in milliseconds, between pushes of CIS resource statistics updates from the CIS Collector to Monitor Server (minimum is 100ms).

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/resource/enable
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS resource updates to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/snapshot/enableSnapshotMonitoring
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS State Snapshots to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/snapshot/snapshotUpdatePeriodMs
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The period, in milliseconds, between pushes of CIS State Snapshot from CIS Collector to Monitor Server (minimum is 100ms).

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/collector/traffic/enableTrafficMonitoring
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', the CIS Collector will periodically collect and send CIS Request Traffic to a connected Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/client/idleTimeoutSeconds
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The amount of time in seconds a client needs to be idle before it will be considered expired. (minimum is 1 second).

The Composite Monitor Server aggregates CIS sessions together which have the same host, client type, user name, and domain name into a single client.

This allows similar CIS sessions from CIS nodes in a cluster or connectionless sessions, such as those created by web services to appear as one logical client for monitoring purposes.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/client/purgePeriodMs
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The period, in milliseconds, between purges of expired clients from the Composite Monitor server (minimum is 100ms).

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/domain
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The user domain of the remote CIS connection.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/forceSingleServer
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', then the Monitor Server will strictly monitor the CIS as a single standalone instance. Otherwise, it will attempt to monitor the entire cluster that the CIS system is part of. If the CIS system is not part of a cluster, then this option has no effect and is treated as 'true'. If the monitored CIS is 'localhost', this option has no effect and is treated as 'true'.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/host
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The host of the remote CIS connection.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/password
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The password for the "monitor" system user within the "composite" domain that the Monitor Server will use to connect with the remote CIS.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/port
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The base port of the remote CIS connection.

If this value is non-zero, then that port will be used.

If this value is 0 and the host is "localhost", then the port of this CIS instance will be used; otherwise port 9400 will be used.

See the effective port for the actual port that will be used.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/portEffective
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The effective port used to connect to the remote CIS connection.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the actual remote CIS port that will be or is used for making connections.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/reconnectPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The period in seconds the Monitor Server will wait before attempting to reconnect with a CIS system after a connection is broken.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/secondaryHosts
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The list of hosts that are known to be in the cluster that the Monitor Server connects with. If the Monitor Server fails to connect with a CIS instance when it first starts up, it will try one of of the other hosts in this list. This list is automatically populated when a the Monitor Server is configured to monitor a CIS instance as a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/secondaryPorts
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The list of ports that are known to be in the cluster that the Monitor Server connects with. If the Monitor Server fails to connect with a CIS instance when it first starts up, it will try one of of the other hosts in this list. This list is automatically populated when a the Monitor Server is configured to monitor a CIS instance as a cluster. This corresponds with the secondary list of hosts.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/connection/user
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The user of the remote CIS connection.

serverAttributeDef.name: /monitor/server/enabled
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If 'true', then this CIS will run Composite Monitor Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/api/protocol/protocolVersion
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This value indicates the version of the API protocol that this server supports natively.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/api/protocol/supportedProtocolVersions
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This value provides the list of protocol versions the server can support listed in order from most ideal to least ideal.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/enableClientAuthentication
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If true, X.509 client certificate authentication (i.e. mutual authentication) is enabled for SSL authentication.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/enableClientAuthenticationOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If true, X.509 client certificate authentication (i.e. mutual authentication) is enabled for SSL authentication.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/generateSSLDiagnostics
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Whether or not to turn on low-level SSL debugging. This setting generates highly verbose logs and should be set to false when not in use. SSL Logging for incoming connections will not be affected until server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/issuerDN
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Issuer distinguished name of server used in SSL authentication.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/keystoreKeyAlias
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The alias name of the key entry (i.e public certificate) used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/keystoreKeyAliasOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The alias name of the key entry (i.e public certificate) used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/keystoreLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the keystore file used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients. The keystore file must contain exactly one key entry (i.e. private key/certificate pair). It may also contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/keystoreLocationOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the keystore file used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients. The keystore file must contain exactly one key entry (i.e. private key/certificate pair). It may also contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/keystorePassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the keystore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the keystore file must use the same password as the file itself.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/keystorePasswordOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the keystore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the keystore file must use the same password as the file itself.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/keystoreType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the keystore file. It must be a valid keystore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/keystoreTypeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the keystore file. It must be a valid keystore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongKeystoreKeyAlias
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The alias name of the key entry (i.e public certificate) used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong keystore is a keystore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongKeystoreKeyAliasOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The alias name of the key entry (i.e public certificate) used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong keystore is a keystore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Strong Keystore Key Alias (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongKeystoreLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the keystore file used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients. The keystore file must contain exactly one key entry (i.e. private key/certificate pair). It may also contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong keystore is a keystore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongKeystoreLocationOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the keystore file used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients. The keystore file must contain exactly one key entry (i.e. private key/certificate pair). It may also contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong keystore is a keystore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Strong Keystore File Location (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongKeystorePassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the keystore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the keystore file must use the same password as the file itself.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong keystore is a keystore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongKeystorePasswordOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the keystore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the keystore file must use the same password as the file itself.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong keystore is a keystore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongKeystoreType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the keystore file. It must be a valid keystore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong keystore is a keystore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongKeystoreTypeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the keystore file. It must be a valid keystore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong keystore is a keystore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Strong Keystore File Type (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongTruststoreLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the truststore file used in SSL authentication to decide what external clients the server should trust. The truststore file can contain contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong truststore is a truststore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.

Trusted certificate entries in the truststore file can have any number of bits.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/strongTruststoreLocationOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the truststore file used in SSL authentication to decide what external clients the server should trust. The truststore file can contain contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

Trusted certificate entries in the truststore file can have any number of bits.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Strong Truststore File Location (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the keystore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the keystore file must use the same password as the file itself.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

This setting will only be active if a server license with strong encryption is enabled. A strong truststore is a truststore file that has key entries with more than 512-bits.

Trusted certificate entries in the truststore file can have any number of bits.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Strong Keystore File Type (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/subjectDN
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Subject distinguished name of server used in SSL authentication.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/truststoreLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the truststore file used in SSL authentication to decide what external clients the server should trust. The truststore file can contain contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/truststoreLocationOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the truststore file used in SSL authentication to decide what external clients the server should trust. The truststore file can contain contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
