serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the truststore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the truststore file must use the same password as the file itself.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/truststorePasswordOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the truststore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the truststore file must use the same password as the file itself.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/truststoreType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the truststore file. It must be a valid truststore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/communications/truststoreTypeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the truststore file. It must be a valid truststore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cache/cacheRefreshMinimumDelaySeconds
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Minimum delay between two consecutive cache refreshes for a cached resource, useful in a clustered enviornment to avoid unnecessary successive cache refreshes.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Minimum Interval Between Two Cache Refreshes

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cache/failoverToOriginalDatasource
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Applicable to cached resources using a relational cache. When set to true, if the cache is not accessible, the resources will be treated as not being cached.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cache/garbageCollectionDelaySeconds
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Collect and then delete the cached data after this many seconds. Too aggressively delete data could lead to cache refresh errors in cluster mode.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cache/loading/enableNativeLoading
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Indicates whether cache loading using native mechanisms, such as Oracle Database Links, is enabled.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cache/loading/enableParallelLoading
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Indicates whether parallel cache loading is enabled.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cache/statusSyncMaxInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Maximum allowed interval between syncing in memory cache status with that in database table. This need not be set for automatic caching.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/checkConnectionInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Time threshold in minutes beyond which the Server considers itself BLOCKED if it has not received a pending response.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/displayName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
A user-editable name of the cluster.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/globalCid
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current global change id.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/healthmonitor/aggressiveHeartbeatInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Once any node is flagged as down how often to check for heartbeat of other nodes, in seconds

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/healthmonitor/db/heartbeatTable
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Health Monitor heart beat table path in CIS
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Health Monitor Heartbeat Table Path in CIS

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/healthmonitor/heartbeatInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Number of seconds between heartbeats

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/healthmonitor/heartbeatReadInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Number of seconds to wait after sending a heartbeat before reading heartbeats of other nodes in cluster

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/healthmonitor/tolerance
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Number of seconds to wait once a node is found to be unresponsive before flagging it as down

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/heartbeatInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Number of seconds between heartbeat messages Server sends out to other cluster members.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/heartbeatIntervalOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Number of seconds between heartbeat messages Server sends out to other cluster members.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/loggingLevel
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Can be set to OFF (no detailed logging is enabled), MEMBER (log member and timekeeper changes only), METADATA (in addition to member and timekeeper changes, log metadata changes as well), ALL (log all cluster communications)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/name
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
An internally-generated name to uniquely identify a cluster, constructed as "creationtime-hashCodeOfServerId".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/retentionPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The minimum number of hours the Server will keep a metadata object after it is deleted. This is needed only if some server(s) in the cluster are not up all the time, or the network among the cluster members are intermittent. This setting is ignored if all servers in the cluster are running and communicating with each other.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/retryInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The time interval in seconds between the Server's attempts to contact a non-responding remote cluster node.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/serverId
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
A 32-bit value to uniquely identify a server node in a cluster.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/timeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The number of seconds the Server will wait for an initial response while establishing a connection to a remote cluster node.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/cluster/triggerDistribution/timeKeeperWeight
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Set this if time keeper needs special weight in weighted round robin trigger distribution. For most use cases this value need not be set.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/bundled
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Indicates whether or not the repository database is the one bundled with the product.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemPool/connectionValidationQuery
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Connection Validation Query would run on repository database and if successful would validate the connection to the repository database.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemPool/poolInitialSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Initial number of internal database connections opened for use by the Server metadata sub-system. Note that this number must be between the "Minimum" and "Maximum".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemPool/poolInitialSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Initial number of internal database connections opened for use by the Server metadata sub-system. Note that this number must be between the "Minimum" and "Maximum". If this value is less than the "Minimum" or greater than "Maximum", it will be reset to the value of "Minimum" to ensure that the server can be started successfully.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemPool/poolMaxSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Maximum number of internal database connections opened for use by the Server metadata sub-system. Note that this number must be greater than the "Minimum".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemPool/poolMaxSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Maximum number of internal database connections opened for use by the Server metadata sub-system. Note that this number must be greater than the "Minimum". If this value is less than the "Minimum", the value of "Minimum" will be reset to this value to ensure that the server can be started successfully.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemPool/poolMinSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Minimum number of internal database connections opened for use by the Server metadata sub-system. Note that this number must be less than the "Maximum".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemPool/poolMinSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Minimum number of internal database connections opened for use by the Server metadata sub-system. Note that this number must be less than the "Maximum". If this value is greater than the "Maximum", it will be reset to the value of "Maximum" to ensure that the server can be started successfully.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemTablePool/connectionValidationQuery
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Connection Validation Query would run on repository database and if successful would validate the connection to the repository database.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemTablePool/poolInitialSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Initial number of internal database connections opened for client access to system tables. Note that this number must be between the "Minimum" and "Maximum".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemTablePool/poolInitialSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Initial number of internal database connections opened for client access to system tables. Note that this number must be between the "Minimum" and "Maximum". If this value is less than the "Minimum" or greater than "Maximum", it will be reset to the value of "Minimum" to ensure that the server can be started successfully.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemTablePool/poolMaxSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Maximum number of internal database connections opened for client access to system tables. Note that this number must be greater than the "Minimum".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemTablePool/poolMaxSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Maximum number of internal database connections opened for client access to system tables. Note that this number must be greater than the "Minimum". If this value is less than the "Minimum", the value of "Minimum" will be reset to this value to ensure that the server can be started successfully.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemTablePool/poolMinSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Minimum number of internal database connections opened for client access to system tables. Note that this number must be less than the "Maximum".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionPools/systemTablePool/poolMinSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Minimum number of internal database connections opened for client access to system tables. Note that this number must be less than the "Maximum". If this value is greater than the "Maximum", it will be reset to the value of "Maximum" to ensure that the server can be started successfully.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/connectionUrl
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The JDBC URL that will be used to connect to the external database. For example, "jdbc:mysql://localhost:3406/cs030101?continueBatchOnError=false&useUnicode=true".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/databaseCatalog
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The database catalog that contains the Composite schema. It may be blank if the database does not support catalogs.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/databaseHost
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The hostname where the database is located.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/databaseName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The name of the database within the database.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/databasePassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The database password.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/databasePort
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The port where the database is located.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/databaseSchema
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The database schema that contains the Composite schema. It may be blank if the database does not support schemas.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/databaseUser
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The database user name.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/driverClass
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The fully qualified class name of a JDBC compliant driver. For example, "com.mysql.jdbc.Driver".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/driverClassPath
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
A semi-colon or colon separated list of jar files and directories. For example, "/tmp/oracle40.jar:/tmp".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/driverLibraryPath
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The system path for any third party libraries that are used by the driver to create connections to repository database.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/driverName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The name of the Composite datasource driver name. This is required for proper operation of the system tables.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/driverType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The name of the Composite datasource driver type. This is required for proper operation of the system tables.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/loadExamples
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Indicates whether or not to load examples resources to a bundled repository.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/repositoryChanged
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Set to true if the repository configuration has been changed. False if not. The server sets this to false on startup after doing post-change processing.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/repositoryClass
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The repository class name.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/schemaCreateScript
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The Composite schema creation script. This script contains the SQL commands to create the Composite schema.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/schemaDropScript
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The Composite schema drop script. This script contains the SQL commands to drop the Composite schema.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/schemaInitializeScript
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The Composite initialize script. This script contains the SQL commands to initialize the Composite tables.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/database/serviceName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The Composite repository service name. This value is only used by Window platforms.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/DisableCardinalityHistogramCompression
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Defaults to "false". When "true", CIS server will not redistribute cardinality histogram data.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/NumberOfCardinalityHistogramBuckets
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If specified, CIS will use user supplied value for number of cardinality histogram buckets; otherwise CIS will automatically choose the number of histogram buckets. Number of buckets should be specified as a comma separated list of TablePATH/columnname=value; value can only be integer value greater than 0. Example: /shared/examples/ds_inventory/products/col1=10, /shared/examples/ds_inventory/purchaseorders/col2=20

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/cache/coupleWritersWithReaders
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Useful in overriding the default parallel cache loading policy using writer threads that are decoupled from reader threads. It should not be modified unless requested by Composite support. This setting will not be propagated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/cache/parallelLoadingLevel
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Useful in overriding the auto-determined number of reader threads used by parallel cache loading, when applicable. It should not be modified unless requested by Composite support. This setting will not be propagated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/dbchannelTraceLevel
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "0". At level "1", the server will log connection events. At level "2", the server will log all but data transfer events. At level "3", the server logs all events, including data. This setting should only be used when requested by Composite support to help in debugging an issue.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/delayBetweenCacheGarbageCollectionJobs
serverAttributeDef.annotation: useful in reducing performance impact due to cache clear jobs; this parameter specifies delay, in seconds, between any two successive cache clear jobs. Set to 0 if no delay is required between successive cache clear jobs.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Delay required between successive cache clear jobs in seconds

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/disableAllConnectionSafetyChecks
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This mode is used for performance testing. When true, many parts of the system that log requests, change thread priories, validate connections, etc. are disabled. This mode should never be used in production.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/disableCacheOrphanGarbageCollection
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Set to false by default. Disables cache garbage collection for orphan data (data whose cache keys does not exist in status table). This could help in reducing the load on cache target table due to cache refresh.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/disableCacheRefreshes
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will ignore all cache refreshes. This setting should only be used when requested by Composite support to help in debugging an issue.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/disableRequestThrottling
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Setting true will disable incoming request throttling. Enabling this may result in CPU starvation if too many requests are processed simultaneously.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/disableSSL
serverAttributeDef.annotation: SSL for intra-cluster communication is disabled if set to true.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/disableSSLOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Disable SSL for intra-cluster communication if set to true.

This parameter should only be changed when the server is not in a cluster.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/discardDSData
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If true, all data produced by data sources will be discarded and the data fetched will not be converted into composite value objects. This configuration is useful for performance testing to determine how much the value object conversion contributes to latency.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/discardDbchannelData
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If true, all data produced by executing JDBC and ODBC requests will be not be sent to the client. This configuration is useful for performance testing to determine how much the JDBC/ODBC protocol contributes to latency.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableBulkDataLoading
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Setting to true will:

1. Allow INSERT/SELECT statements inserting rows into Netezza to use bulk loading methods.
2. Allow procedures cached into Netezza to use bulk loading methods.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableDataShipProfiling
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will produce profiling information for each DataShip request in excess of what is normally produced. This will have negative performance impact. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableDebug
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will produce significant debugging output into its standard log file. This will have negative performance impact. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableDebugForDataSources
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Setting true will log debug information for any datasource
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Debug Output Enabled for Data Sources

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableDebugForMemoryRequests
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Setting true will log debug information for managed memory allocation requests
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Debug Output Enabled for Managed Memory Allocation Requests

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableDebugForPools
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Defaults to false. When set to true, the server will periodically log the thread stack, which checks out connection from data source connection pool, into the cs_server_status.log
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Debug Connection Pool Enabled for Data Sources

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableDetailedProfiling
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will produce detailed profiling information in excess of what is normally produced. This will have negative performance impact. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableGroupProfiling
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will produce profiling information for each CIS group. This will have negative performance impact. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableRequestDebugging
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", each incoming request will produce significant debugging output into separate log files. This will have negative performance impact and may result in the creation of many log files. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableRequestProfiling
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will produce profiling information for each request in excess of what is normally produced. This will have negative performance impact. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableSessionDebugging
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", each session will produce significant debugging output into separate log files. This will have negative performance impact and may result in the creation of many log files. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableSessionProfiling
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will produce profiling information for each session. This will have negative performance impact. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableSqlProfiling
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will produce aggregate profiling information for incoming sql statements. This will have negative performance impact. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/enableUserProfiling
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will produce profiling information for each user. This will have negative performance impact. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/fakeJdbcData
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When enabled, result sets from queries to a JDBC data source are cached in memory. The cached data is discarded when this mode is disabled. This mode is used to help debug performance issues. It should never be enabled on a production system.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Cache Result Sets from JDBC Data Sources

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/keepDataShipTempFileTables
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true", the server will not delete temp table or file generated for each DataShip request. This option should only be enabled when requested by a support team member.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: DataShip Keep Temp File or Table

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/maxConcurrentCacheGarbageCollectionJobs
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Useful in controlling maximum number of cache clear jobs. This will not take effect if delayBetweenGarbageCollectionJobs is set. Set to -1 if there is no restriction on maximum number of concurrent cache clear jobs.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Maximum number of concurrent cache clear jobs

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/onlyDebugExceptions
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "true". When "true", the server will produce debugging output related to foreground request execution into its standard log file. When "false", the server will send such errors to the client without logging them. It will only log internal errors.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Debug Output Enabled for Request Failures

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/repositoryConnClosers
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "false". When "true" and a "Repository is closed" exception occurs, the identity of the closing thread is also display. This setting should only be used when requested by Composite support to help in debugging an issue.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/serializeCache
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to false. When set to true, cache refresh will not start until all cache operations are finished.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/serverStatusLoggingPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to an hour. When enabled the server will periodically log various usage statistics into the cs_server_status.log. A value of 0 stops the server from logging this information.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/debug/useFifoRepositoryCache
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Defaults to "false". When "true", the repository cache will use a FIFO eviction algorithm. This may result in more database hits. This may also result in better repository performance once the cache is loaded. When 'false', LRU is the algorithm. Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/email/messageFromAddress
serverAttributeDef.annotation: When sending out e-mail messages, the server uses this value in the From Address field. The value must be of the format username@hostname.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/email/smtpAuthRequired
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting should be enabled if the SMTP server requires authentication for sending emails.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/email/smtpAuthUserName
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The user name is used for connecting to the SMTP server for sending emails.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/email/smtpAuthUserPassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The password is used for connecting to the SMTP server for sending emails.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/email/smtpHost
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting contains the host name or IP address of the SMTP server that the Server uses when sending out e-mail.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/email/smtpPort
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting contains the port number of the SMTP server that the Server uses when sending out e-mail.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/configDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the Server configuration directory, relative to the installation directory.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/customAdapterDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the custom adapter directory, relative to the installation directory.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/customJarImportDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the directory where imported Java Jar files will be placed.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/databaseInstallDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the Server database directory.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/javaSecurityPropertiesFile
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the Composite Server Java security properties file.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/jreDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the read-only Java runtime (JRE) directory.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/logDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Directory location that the Server uses for log files.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/logDirectoryOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Directory location that the Server uses for log files. Changing this value will not copy any log files to the new location. If the directory does not exist or the server or monitor processes do not have permission to create files in the directory, the server may be unable to start.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/logFiles
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Names of the logging files for the server.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/logFilesExtended
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Names of the logging files plus additional log information that may be useful for diagnostics.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/serverAppsInstallDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the read-only Server directory.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/serverConfInstallDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the read/write Server directory.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/serverDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the Server directory relative to the installation.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/tempDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Directory location that the Server uses for caching and data processing.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/files/tempDirectoryOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Directory location that the Server uses for caching and data processing. Changing this value will not copy any temporary files to the new location. This will cause any automatic file caches and gathered statistics information to appear to be cleared.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/hooks/enableHooks
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If true, then installed hooks will be applied to all incoming SQL and procedure requests. This also disables all performance advantages from prepared statements. If false, hooks are not used even if present, and prepared statements run normally. The use of hooks is strongly discouraged in production systems as they can lead to performance and stability problems with the server depending on the logic in installed hooks. You may be requested to disable hooks when contacting support.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/hooks/preventDisablement
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If true, then runtime errors will not cause hooks to be disabled.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/currentTime
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current time and date on the server in XML Schema format. The trailing 'Z' indicates GMT time.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/displayName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
A user-editable name of server.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/hostIpAddress
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The IP address of the server's host.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/hostName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The hostname of the server's host.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/jreVmMode
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The Java runtime (JRE) VM mode of operation. 32-bit or 64-bit.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/locale
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting determines the default locale of the server. Possible values are fr, en, and ru.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/name
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The software product name.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/serverId
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Server ID is a unique identifier for a single installation. This is set once at installation when the server is first started.

Server ID is a read-only value set as a unique identifier for the installation.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/serviceName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The Composite server service name. This value is only used by Window platforms.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/timeZone
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The time zone the server is running in.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/version
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The software version number of the server.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/versionDetail
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The software version of the server, including information on current patch and hotfix level.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/versionFull
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The software version of the server in number.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/versionFullDetail
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The software version of the server, including information on all patches and hotfixes applied.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/info/versionName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The software version of the server without patch and hotfix level information.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/license/licenseFile
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Name of the license file, relative to the configuration directory.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/batchParallelizationThreshold
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Parallelize batch operations when the number of batches in a single operation exceeds this threshold. Setting it to a large number effectively disables it.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/changeLog/enable
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If true, a summary of all changes to server metadata will be logged to a file on disk. The log will include the full path of the resource that was modified, the name of the user that modified it, and the time at which it was last modified.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/changeLog/fileName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Name of the metadata change log. The file will be created under the path specified by Log Directory.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/changeLog/maxFiles
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of log files. The minimum value is 1.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/changeLog/maxFilesOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of log files. The minimum value is 1.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Maximum Number Of Log Files (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/changeLog/maxKBytes
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum size of all log files combined, in kilobytes. The minimum value is 64.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Maximum Size Of All Log Files

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/changeLog/maxKBytesOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum size of all log files combined, in kilobytes. The minimum value is 64.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Maximum Size Of All Log Files (On ServerRestart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/commitCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The commit record cache holds the most often-used metadata commit records in order to reduce access to the internal database. The commit record cache is stored in the "Reserved Memory" area. The minimum size is 100 records and the default size is 1000 records.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/commitCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The commit record cache holds the most often-used metadata commit records in order to reduce access to the internal database. The commit record cache is stored in the "Reserved Memory" area. The minimum size is 100 records and the default size is 1000 records.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Metadata Commit Cache Size (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/optimizeDatabaseOnStartup
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If true, the metadata tables will be analyzed for fragmentation and automatically optimized if necessary each time the server is started. Table fragmentation is not common and rarely is severe enough to adversly impact server performance. If defragmentation is necessary then the server may take longer to restart. The default value for this option is false.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/privilegeCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The privilege cache holds the most often-used privilege data in memory in order to reduce access to the database. Consider increasing this cache if the "Privilege Cache Access" falls below 90% under normal stable workload.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/privilegeCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The privilege cache holds the most often-used privilege data in memory in order to reduce access to the database. Consider increasing this cache if the "Privilege Cache Access" falls below 90% under normal stable workload.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/purgeThreshold
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This configuration setting determines how many metadata objects may be deleted before the metadata repository is garbage collected. The minimum value is 1 object and the default value is 2000 objects.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/purgeThresholdOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This configuration setting determines how many metadata objects may be deleted before the metadata repository is garbage collected. The minimum value is 1 object and the default value is 2000 objects.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/relationshipCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The relationship cache holds the most often-used relationship data in memory in order to reduce access to the database. Consider increasing this cache if the "Relationship Cache Access" falls below 90% under normal stable workload.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/relationshipCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The relationship cache holds the most often-used relationship data in memory in order to reduce access to the database. Consider increasing this cache if the "Relationship Cache Access" falls below 90% under normal stable workload.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/resourceCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The metadata cache holds the most often-used metadata objects in memory in order to reduce access to the internal database. Server performance can improve with a larger cache size. However, increasing the size of the cache will reduce the amount of memory available for query processing. The metadata cache is stored in the "Managed Memory" area and will never grow larger than 25% of the total amount of managed memory, regardless of how large the cache size is set. The minimum size is 500 objects and the default size is 10000 objects. Please check the "Repository Cache Access" statistic in the Server Overview console. Consider increasing this cache if the "Repository Cache Access" falls below 90% under normal stable workload.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/resourceCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The metadata cache holds the most often-used metadata objects in memory in order to reduce access to the internal database. Server performance can improve with a larger cache size. However, increasing the size of the cache will reduce the amount of memory available for query processing. The metadata cache is stored in the "Managed Memory" area and will never grow larger than 25% of the total amount of managed memory, regardless of how large the cache size is set. The minimum size is 500 objects and the default size is 10000 objects. Please check the "Repository Cache Access" statistic in the Server Overview console. Consider increasing this cache if the "Repository Cache Access" falls below 90% under normal stable workload.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/useCorrectXmlNullableSettings
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
true: When converting data types from native XML to CIS relational, only nillable XML elements will be marked as nullable.

false: When converting data types from native XML to CIS relational, all generated elements will be marked as nullable.

This setting allows transformations to use XML data types with expectations set correctly for nullability and should cause fewer warnings to appear due to nullable vs. not-nullable mismatches. This setting defaults to false to conform with the behavior of older versions of the CIS. This setting only affects the nullability of newly created types that are derived from XML.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/userCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The user cache holds the most often-used user data in memory in order to reduce access to the database. Consider increasing this cache if the "User Cache Access" falls below 90% under normal stable workload.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/metadata/userCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The user cache holds the most often-used user data in memory in order to reduce access to the database. Consider increasing this cache if the "User Cache Access" falls below 90% under normal stable workload.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/monitor/pingInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Ping frequency specified in seconds to send out server pings.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/monitor/pingTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Timeout value in seconds used to determine that a server ping has failed.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/monitor/port
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Port that the monitor process receives requests from the Studio. This port is always set to 6 ports higher than the server's web services port.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/monitor/serverIgnoreSignals
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
true: enable the option to ignore operating system signals for the JVM used by the Composite Server. false: disable the option to ignore operating system signals for the JVM used by the Composite Server.

This setting is useful for Windows systems that require the Composite Server process to not terminate during a Windows logoff event. It uses the -Xrs Sun JVM flag to provide this functionality. Please refer to http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/windows/java.html for further details.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/monitor/serverIgnoreSignalsOnMonitorRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
true: enable the option to ignore operating system signals for the JVM used by the Composite Server. false: disable the option to ignore operating system signals for the JVM used by the Composite Server.

This setting is useful for Windows systems that require the Composite Server process to not terminate during a Windows logoff event. It uses the -Xrs Sun JVM flag to provide this functionality. Please refer to http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/tooldocs/windows/java.html for further details.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next monitor restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/monitor/showMessageBoxOnError
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
true: enable debugging for a fatal error encountered in the Composite Server JVM. false: disable debugging for a fatal error encountered in the Composite Server JVM.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/monitor/showMessageBoxOnErrorOnMonitorRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
true: enable debugging for a fatal error encountered in the Composite Server JVM. false: disable debugging for a fatal error encountered in the Composite Server JVM.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next monitor restart.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Show Message Box On Error(On Monitor Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/disableHttpsHostnameVerification
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Disable hostname verification when connecting to servers using HTTPS. Use with caution. Disabling hostname verification for HTTPS connections weakens the security of the connection.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/hostname
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The hostname of the server.

The network host name defaults to the local computer network name.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/nioConnectorMaxIdleTime
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum amount of time in seconds for an idle NIO connection to wait for a request or read before the HTTP/S connection closes.

This value does not take effect until server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/ftp/enableProxy
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Use proxy server for FTP connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/ftp/proxyExclusions
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
A list of hosts which should be connected to directly. Connections to these hosts will not be routed through the proxy server. The value can be a list of hosts, each seperated by a ',', and in addition a wildcard character '*' can be used for matching. For example: "localhost, *.composite.com, 10.1.1.18, 192.168.*.*".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/ftp/proxyHost
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The host name or IP address of the FTP Proxy server.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/ftp/proxyPort
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The port used to communicate with the FTP Proxy server.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/http/enableProxy
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Use proxy server for HTTP connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/http/proxyExclusions
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
A list of hosts which should be connected to directly. Connections to these hosts will not be routed through the proxy server. The value can be a list of hosts, each seperated by a ',', and in addition a wildcard character '*' can be used for matching. For example: "localhost, *.composite.com, 10.1.1.18, 192.168.*.*".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/http/proxyHost
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The host name or IP address of the HTTP Proxy server.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/http/proxyPassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password used to authenticate to the proxy server. Leave it blank if no authentication is required. The value of the password stored on the server is encrypted, therefore the length of the password that is displayed is not necessarily the same length as the unencrypted password.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/http/proxyPort
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The port used to communicate with the HTTP Proxy server.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/http/proxyUsername
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The username used to authenticate to the proxy server. Leave it empty if no authentication is required.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/https/enableProxy
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Use proxy server for HTTPS connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/https/proxyExclusions
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
A list of hosts which should be connected to directly. Connections to these hosts will not be routed through the proxy server. The value can be a list of hosts, each seperated by a ',', and in addition a wildcard character '*' can be used for matching. For example: "localhost, *.composite.com, 10.1.1.18, 192.168.*.*".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/https/proxyHost
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The host name or IP address of the HTTPS Proxy server.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/https/proxyPassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password used to authenticate to the proxy server. Leave it blank if no authentication is required. The value of the password stored on the server is encrypted, therefore the length of the password that is displayed is not necessarily the same length as the unencrypted password.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/https/proxyPort
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The port used to communicate with the HTTPS Proxy server.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/proxy/https/proxyUsername
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The username used to authenticate to the proxy server. Leave it blank if no authentication is required.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/useBlockingIOConnectors
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When Use Blocking IO Connectors is set to false (the default value), Composite Server uses NIO for communications with Composite applications over HTTP and SSL/HTTPS. When Use Blocking IO connectors is set to true, Composite Server, on server restart, uses Blocking IO connectors for communications with Composite applications over HTTP and SSL/HTTPS.

It is recommended to use Blocking IO connectors on platforms with known NIO connector problems. Composite Server restart is required for the change in the value of this setting to take effect.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/net/wsdlhostname
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The hostname used for web service addresses published in the WSDL file.

The network host name defaults to the local computer network name, but it may be changed to use another host name like a DNS to support use of a third party load balancer for distribution of web services requests.

Use the Apply button to change all current WSDL definition sets (except local system WSDL definition sets) with the new network host name. This will reset the named location for web services in the Composite repository.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/osgi/bundles/BundleUninstallPauseInMillis
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Composite Server pause time in milli seconds after an OSGi bundle is stopped and uninstalled when a composite project is undeployed.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/osgi/bundles/bundleDirectory
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Directory location that the Composite Server uses for loading OSGi bundles.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/AllowNTLM
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Whether or not to allow NTLM to be used for authentication; do not enable before configuring NTLM (see documentation for details).

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/AthnFailureLimit
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The number of failed login attempts before a user account is locked

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/EnableAthnLocking
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Turns on or off account locking due to authentication failure.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/IPFiltering/Forbidden
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
IP Addresses and Address Patterns (e.g. 10.*.*.*) from which no user may authenticate.

If no addresses or address patterns are specified, then any address is allowed.

The address pattern *.*.*.* will be disregarded.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/IPFiltering/Required
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
IP Addresses and Address Patterns (e.g. 10.*.*.*) from which a user may be authenticated.

If no addresses or address patterns are specified, then no particular address is required.

The address pattern *.*.*.* will be disregarded.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/NTLMDomain
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The external domain being used for NTLM authentication. This is only ever required for non-Microsoft hosts. For Microsoft Windows hosts or SAMBA-based hosts that are configured to return usernames in "DOMAIN\user" format, use the Windows Domain Mapping setting instead of configuring this setting.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/TolerateUnusedSchemes
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Valid values are "WARN", "IGNORE", "ERROR".

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/WindowsDomainMapping
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The mapping from the reported windows domain of an authenticated user to the name of the corresponding external domain as it is defined in the Composite Server. The reported domain is the windows domain as it would be specified in a SAM name such as "DOMAINNAME\username".

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/kerberos/AllowKerberos
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This property enables or disables Kerberos authentication. Do not enable Kerberos authentication prior to configuration or authentication failures may occur.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/kerberos/Debug
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When set to True, the JDK's Kerberos implementation will log output messages to the cs_server.out file in the logs directory.

It's JGSS Property.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/kerberos/KeyTab
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The KeyTab file contains pairs of Kerberos principals and encrypted keys used to authenticate the Composite Server to the Kerberos KDC.

To enable CIS authentication with Kerberos:

Generate a KeyTab file using the Kerberos ktpass utility and place that file in a directory that is locally accessible to CIS.

Enter the directory path and name of the KeyTab file generated for CIS usage as the value of this property.

It's JGSS Property.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/kerberos/Krb5Conf
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The kerberos configuration file contains Kerberos configuration information, including the locations of KDCs and admin servers for the Kerberos realms of interest, defaults for the current realm and for Kerberos applications, and mappings of hostnames onto Kerberos realms. On Windows, this is usually c:\WINDOWS\krb.ini; on Unix, it is usually /etc/krb.conf.

Changes to this value do not take effect until server restart.

It's JGSS Property.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/kerberos/Native
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This property switch Kerberos facilities between SSPI and JGSS.

"True": use SSPI facility.

"False": use JGSS facility.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/authentication/kerberos/PrincipalName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Enter the Service Principal Name registered by the Kerberos KDC. The entry will have a format like the following:

HTTP/hostname@DOMAIN

It's JGSS Property.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/enableAnonymousLogin
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
true: enable anonymous user login in the Composite domain. false: disable anonymous user login in the Composite domain.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/enableDynamicLogin
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
true: enable Dynamic domain. false: disable Dynamic domain.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/enablePrivilegeLogging
serverAttributeDef.annotation: if true, privilege changes to otherwise unchanged resources will be written to the metadata log

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/enableRowBasedSecurity
serverAttributeDef.annotation: determines whether Row Based Security is on or off

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/export/ownerOnly
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Only allow the owner of a resource to export it.

Note: The admin user may always perform a package export regardless of whether this configuration option is set.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/export/requiredGroupMembership
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Restrict package export to members of the group specified here.

Note: The admin user may always perform a package export regardless of whether this configuration option is set.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/export/stripPasswords
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Strip passwords from exported resources.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/security/export/writersOnly
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Only allow users with write privileges to a resource to export it.

Note: The admin user may always perform a package export regardless of whether this configuration option is set.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/support/uploadURL
serverAttributeDef.annotation: URL used by Send/Save Logs for Support to upload files to Composite Support

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/transactions/maxParameterSizeLogged
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This value specifies an upper limit on the size for a parameter value to be added the transaction log. Parameter values that exceed this size will be truncated before being added to the transaction log.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/transactions/maxRequestDepth
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This value specifies an upper limit on the depth of the request stack in a transaction.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/transactions/maxTotalSizeLogged
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This value specifies an upper limit on the total size for a work unit be added the transaction log. Statements that exceed this size will be truncated before being added to the transaction log.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/config/xslt/enablePersistent
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
true: enable persistent when executing XSLT transformation. It is for larget document transformation. false: disable persistent when executing XSLT transformation.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/conditions/storage/storageLowCheckPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines how often the storage threshold is checked for the Composite Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/conditions/storage/storageLowCheckPeriodOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Determines how often the storage threshold is checked for the Composite Server.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Storage Size Check Period (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/conditions/storage/storageLowCritical
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines when a storage critical warning event will occur.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/conditions/storage/storageLowWarning
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines when a storage low warning event will occur.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/enableEvents
serverAttributeDef.annotation: true: enable event generation. false: disable all event generation for the server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/caches/cacheClear
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/caches/cacheDisable
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.annotation: true: enable all events for this category. false: disable all events for this category.

serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/transactions/enableAll
serverAttributeDef.annotation: true: enable all events for this category. false: disable all events for this category.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/transactions/transactionCommit
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/transactions/transactionCompensate
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.
