serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/transactions/transactionFail
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/transactions/transactionRollBack
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/transactions/transactionStart
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/triggers/enableAll
serverAttributeDef.annotation: true: enable all events for this category. false: disable all events for this category.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/triggers/triggerEnd
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/triggers/triggerFail
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/generation/triggers/triggerStart
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Use a comma to separate multiple choices. Multiple choices cannot include ALL or NONE. Currently supported event filters: <li>DB: event sent to database only. <li>LOG: event sent to log file only. <li>SNMP: event sent to SNMP processor only. <li>CUSTOM: event sent to custom event handler only. <li>ALL: event sent to database, log, SNMP processor, and custom event handler. <li>NONE: event ignored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/custom/customJarLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Location of the jar file that contains a class which implements the EventHandler interface. Only local locations are supported at this time; network mounted directories cannot be used.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/custom/enableCustomLogging
serverAttributeDef.annotation: true: enable custom logger for sending events. false: disable custom logger for sending events.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/database/enableDatabaseLogging
serverAttributeDef.annotation: true: enable database logger for recording events. false: disable database logger for recording events.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/database/flushPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Controls the period in seconds for flushing queued events to the database (and flat files).

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/database/maxLogEntries
serverAttributeDef.annotation: When the number of entries in the event log or database exceeds this value, the oldest events are purged. The value must be between 100 and 10000 entries.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/database/purgeFrequency
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The oldest entries in the events log and database are occassionally purged if they exceed the Maximum Entries threshold. This setting controls how often this check is made. Specifically, whenever N new events are logged, the purge check is made. N is the value of this configuration setting. The value must be between 100 and 5000 entries.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/file/enableFileLogging
serverAttributeDef.annotation: true: enable flat file logger for recording events. false: disable flat file logger for recording events.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/memory/maxViewableEntries
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Controls the maximum number of rows of data a console will keep track of for display in clients.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/snmp/enableSnmp
serverAttributeDef.annotation: true: enable SNMP for sending events. false: disable SNMP for sending events.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/snmp/trapCommunity
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Community name to send SNMP v1 traps to.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/snmp/trapHostList
serverAttributeDef.annotation: A comma separated list of host names/IPs that will be sent SNMP v1 trap messages.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/event/logging/snmp/trapPort
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Port setting for sending SNMP v1 traps.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/communications/cleartextEnabled
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Enable or disable the JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET listener for unencrypted communications.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/communications/hostname
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting contains the host name or IP address used by the server for JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET client connections. Note that changing this setting will require changes to client applications.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/communications/pingInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Ping frequency, specified in seconds. When non-zero, the server sends pings to a JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET driver that is waiting for a response from the CIS server. Composite JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET drivers use this mechanism to avoid a hang issue caused by a driver waiting endlessly for a server response. After the driver sends a request to the server, the server will send pings continuously at the given frequency. If the pings are not received within the time specified by "pingTimeoutWindow", the driver can give up waiting. Default value is "0", which means this mechanism is not in use.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/communications/pingTimeoutWindow
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Timeout value, specified in seconds. When non-zero, this value is used to determine that server ping attempts have failed while a JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET driver was waiting for a response from the CIS server. This option should be used with "pingInterval" and the value should be bigger than or equal to the specified value of "pingInterval". Default value is "0" which means this mechanism is not in use.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/communications/port
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Port that the server listens for JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET client connections. Note that changing this setting will require changes to client applications to connect to the specified port. This port is always set to 1 greater than the server's web services port.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/communications/sslEnabled
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Enable or disable the JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET SSL listener.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/communications/sslPort
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
SSL port on which the Composite Server listens for client connections. This port setting is derived from adding 3 to the Web Services HTTP (Base Port) setting. Changes to the Web Services HTTP Base Port will change this SSL port and all other CIS port settings. Clients must be configured accordingly.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/communications/sslStatus
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current status of the listener.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/data/defaultFetchByteSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Server JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET client fetch byte setting. Fetch byte setting affects the amount of data streamed between the client and server. Use a value of '0' to fetch infinite bytes. This setting is similar to 'Rows To Fetch' in that both control data flow rates between the server and client, and whichever limit is reached first is enforced. Difference is that this setting uses the number of bytes to control the amount of data coming from the server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/data/defaultFetchRows
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Server JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET client fetch row setting. Rows to fetch setting affects the amount of data streamed between the client and server. Use a value of '0' to fetch infinite rows. This setting is similar to 'Bytes To Fetch' in that both control data flow rates between the server and client, and whichever limit is reached first is enforced. Difference is that this setting uses the number of rows to control the amount of data coming from the server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/data/stripTrailingZeros
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Instructs the server to strip trailing zeros in decimal values when possible. This may reduce network traffic. The default value is false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/data/timestampOptimization
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If the server and the client drivers are in the same time zone, this optimization can be enabled for better performance for time-based values - TIMESTAMP, TIME, and DATE. If this optimization is enabled while the server and client drivers are in different time zones, all time values delivered by the client drivers will be incorrect.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/performance/dbchannelQueueSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Defaults to "0". If greater than 0, the server will prefetch data from the data source in the specified number of buffers. This setting is used to reduce the latency of queries that return a lot of rows.

It will not be necessary to restart server if this value changed.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/request/defaultRequestTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The number of seconds of inactivity the Server will wait before closing a JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET request. Use '0' for unlimited.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/request/maxRequests
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The maximum number of simultaneous requests/queries the Composite Server will support across all JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET sessions. Use '0' for unlimited.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/request/showViewsAsTables
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls how Composite Views are reported by the client drivers. When Save Views as Tables is set to true (the default value), Composite Views are saved as tables.

When Save Views as Tables is set to false, Composite Views are saved as views, unless the Composite DDL Native Container Path has been set and they are links to physical tables, in which case they are saved as tables.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/request/showViewsAsTablesOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls how Composite Views are reported by the client drivers. When Save Views as Tables (On Server Restart) is set to true (the default value), Composite Views are saved as tables.

When Save Views as Tables (On Server Restart) is set to false, Composite Views are saved as views, unless the Composite DDL Native Container Path has been set and they are links to physical tables, in which case they are saved as tables.

The Composite Server must be restarted for changes to this value to have effect. This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Save Views as Tables (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/session/defaultSessionTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The number of seconds of inactivity the Server will wait before closing a JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET session. Use '0' for unlimited.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/jdbc/session/maxSessions
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of JDBC/ODBC/ADO.NET client connections the Server will simultaneously support. Use '0' for unlimited.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/heap/javaHeapCurrent
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The amount of Java heap currently in use.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/heap/javaHeapMax
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total amount of Java heap (memory) available for the server's use. The minimum value is 50 MB.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/heap/javaHeapMaxLimit
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The upper limit for the total amount of Java heap (memory) available for the server's use. The default value is the total physical memory calculated on the target installation machine.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Upper Limit of Total Available Memory

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/heap/javaHeapMaxOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total amount of Java heap (memory) available for the server's use. The minimum value is 50 MB.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/managed/managedCurrent
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The amount of managed memory currently in use.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/managed/managedMax
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total amount of managed memory available.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/managed/managedPercent
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This value is the percentage of the (heap minus unmanaged/reserved memory) memory available for query processing. It is set as a percentage to accomodate the uncertainties associated with dynamic memory usage and a factor of safety. For example, if the Java VM heap size is 700 MBytes and the reserved memory is 60 MBytes and this value is 70%, the amount of memory available for query processing is 448 MBytes of memory. If the managed memory setting value is too large, then the server may experience out of memory errors.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/managed/managedPercentOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This value is the percentage of the (heap minus unmanaged/reserved memory) memory available for query processing. It is set as a percentage to accomodate the uncertainties associated with dynamic memory usage and a factor of safety. For example, if the Java VM heap size is 700 MBytes and the reserved memory is 60 MBytes and this value is 70%, the amount of memory available for query processing is 448 MBytes of memory. If the managed memory setting value is too large, then the server may experience out of memory errors.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Percent of Memory to Manage (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/managed/requestQuotaPercent
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This value is the percentage of managed memory that a single request is limited to during execution. This can be used to prevent excessive memory use by a single request.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/managed/unmanagedBase
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This is the memory set aside for use by the server for dynamic actions, so it is not available for use by data processing. If this value is too small, the server may experience out of memory errors.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/managed/unmanagedBaseOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This is the memory set aside for use by the server for dynamic actions, so it is not available for use by data processing. If this value is too small, the server may experience out of memory errors.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/sampling/maxSamples
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This configuration setting determines how many samples are persisted for capturing historical memory monitoring data. The setting of 0 results in no samples being persisted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/memory/sampling/samplePeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This configuration setting determines how often this probe takes a sample for capturing memory monitoring data. The minimum value is once every 1 second.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/io/datasourceBytesIn
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The estimated total number of bytes read into the server from data sources since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/io/datasourceBytesOut
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The estimated total number of bytes sent to data sources by the server since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/io/maxSamples
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This configuration setting determines how many samples are persisted for capturing historical I/O monitoring data. The setting of 0 results in no samples being persisted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/io/samplePeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This configuration setting determines how often this probe takes a sample for capturing I/O monitoring data. The minimum value is once every 1 second.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/purge/samplePurgePeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This configuration setting determines how often the server cleans out memory, I/O, and storage probe data that exceeds the maximum time stored.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/privCacheAccesses
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of privilege cache accesses since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/privCacheHits
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of privilege cache hits since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/privCacheMaxSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum size of the privilege cache.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/privCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current size of the privilege cache.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/resourceCacheAccesses
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of resource cache accesses since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/resourceCacheHits
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of resource cache hits since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/resourceCacheMaxSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum size of the resource cache.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/resourceCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current size of the resource cache.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/userCacheAccesses
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of user cache accesses since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/userCacheHits
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of user cache hits since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/userCacheMaxSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum size of the user cache.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/repository/userCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current size of the user cache.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/requests/maxRequestsTracked
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of requests tracked.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/requests/numDatasourceRequestsActive
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current number of active data source requests.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/requests/numDatasourceRequestsTotal
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of data source requests since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/requests/numRequestsActive
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current number of active requests.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/requests/numRequestsTotal
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of requests since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/requests/numRequestsWaiting
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The number of requests in a wait state at this time.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/requests/numTopRequests
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The number of top memory users and top time (longest running) requests tracked.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/requests/requestPurgePeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Controls how often the server cleans out completed requests down to maximum number tracked.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/sessions/maxSessions
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The maximum number of simultaneous sessions. Use '0' for no limit.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/sessions/maxSessionsTracked
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The maximum number of sessions tracked.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/sessions/numSessionsActive
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current number of active sessions.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/sessions/numSessionsTotal
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of sessions since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/sessions/sessionPurgeIdlePeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Controls how often the server's session reaper attempts to end idle sessions.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/sessions/sessionPurgePeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Controls how often the server cleans out closed sessions down to maximum number tracked.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/sessions/sessionTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Server session timeout setting in seconds. Use a value of '0' to specify an infinite session timeout.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/storage/maxSamples
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This configuration setting determines how many samples are persisted for capturing historical disk storage monitoring data. The setting of 0 results in no samples being persisted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/storage/samplePeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This configuration setting determines how often this probe takes a sample for capturing storage monitoring data. The minimum value is once every 1 second.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/storage/samplePeriodOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This configuration setting determines how often this probe takes a sample for capturing storage monitoring data. The minimum value is once every 1 second.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/transactions/maxTransactionsTracked
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of transactions tracked.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/transactions/numTransactionsActive
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The number of transactions currently active.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/transactions/numTransactionsCommitFailed
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of transactions that failed during commit since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/transactions/numTransactionsRolledBack
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of transactions rolled back since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/transactions/numTransactionsTotal
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of transactions since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/transactions/transactionPurgePeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Controls how often the server cleans out closed transactions down to maximum number tracked.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/triggers/disabled
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether trigger invocation is enabled.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/triggers/numTriggersFailed
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of triggers that have fired and failed since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/triggers/numTriggersTotal
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The total number of triggers that have fired since the server was started.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/triggers/threadPoolSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The size of the trigger worker thread pool.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/waitQueue/minMemory
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If the amount of available memory is below this threshold, queries are queued until more memory is available. This threshold is meant to avoid potentially fatal out-of-memory errors in the Server.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/waitQueue/retryPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If the amount of available memory is below the "Minimum Memory Threshold", the system will repeatedly perform a garbage collection until the memory is above the threshold. The setting determines the frequency of garbage collection attempts. Note that garbage collection is a system resource expensive process so setting the periodocity and threshold pair wisely is important.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/processing/waitQueue/threshold
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This is the number of requests in the wait queue that will trigger a wait queue threshold event.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/cardinalityCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum number of MBytes of memory that will be used to cache information for cardinality estimation.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/cardinalityCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum number of MBytes of memory that will be used to cache information for cardinality estimation.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/flushQueryPlanCacheOnGather
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls if the query plan cache is flushed when new statistics data for cardinality estimation becomes available.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Flush Query Plan Cache on Stats Gather (Current)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/flushQueryPlanCacheOnGatherOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls if the query plan cache is flushed when new statistics data for cardinality estimation becomes available.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Flush Query Plan Cache on Stats Gather (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/planCacheEnabled
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether Query Plan Caching is enabled. If enabled, query plans for the most recently executed SQL are cached. This improves the performance when the same SQL is resubmitted again, since the server does not have to build a new query plan.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/planCacheExpirationDuration
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum duration in which the query plans will remain in cache. This is applicable only if the query plan cache is enabled and does not affect plans already cached.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/planCacheHitRatioTrackingPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether the hit ratio for query plan caching is enabled. If set to a value N that is greater than 0 and query plan caching is enabled, the ratio will be reported every N requests to retrieve cached plans.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Query Plan Cache Hit Ratio Tracking Period

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/planCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum number of query plans that will be cached. This is applicable only if the query plan cache is enabled.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/planCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum number of query plans that will be cached. This is applicable only if the query plan cache is enabled.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Query Plan Cache Size (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/preparedStatementCacheHitRatioTrackingPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether the hit ratio for prepared statetement caching is enabled. If set to a value N that is greater than 0, the ratio will be reported every N requests to retrieve cached plans.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Prepared Statement Cache Hit Ratio Tracking Period

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/preparedStatementCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum number of prepared statement plans that will be cached.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/preparedStatementCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum number of prepared statement plans that will be cached.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Prepared Statement Cache Size (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/runtimeStatsCacheSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum number of runtime stats that will be cached. This is applicable only if the runtime stats is enabled.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/caches/runtimeStatsCacheSizeOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the maximum number of runtime stats that will be cached. This is applicable only if the runtime stats is enabled.

Changing this value will have no effect until the next server restart.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Runtime Stats Cache Size (On Server Restart)

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/language/caseSensitive
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls the default case-sensitivity of queries. If false, string comparisons are done ignoring case. If this setting does not match the case-sensitivity setting of a data source, performance will be degraded when querying that source. Note changing this has no effect on currently running queries.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/language/ignoreTrailingSpaces
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls the ignore trailing spaces during string comparisons in queries. If true, string comparisons are done ignoring trailing spaces. If this setting does not match the trailing spaces setting of a data source, performance will be degraded when querying that source. Note changing this has no effect on currently running queries.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/language/keepComments
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether keep the comments in SQL and pass it to the underlying database. If true, the comments in SQL will be kept.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/resource/enableLogging
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This is used to control logging outputs. Current supported levels:
  • OFF: logging to file will be turned off.
  • INFO: logging to file will be turned on.

    This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/resource/fileRotationPolicy
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The rotation policy determines when to roll this log file which captures query resource. Policy types:
  • 0: time based. When a certain time limit has reached, the log file is closed and rotated out. And a new file is opened. If time-base is hourly, older files are named by adding "1", "2", and all the way until "24" to the base file name. If time-base is daily, older files are named by adding "Monday" "Tuesday", and unitl "Sunday" to the base file name. If time-base is weekly, "1", "2", and until "52" are added to base file. If time-base is monthly, "January", "February", and until "December" are added to base file name.
  • 1: file size based. When the log file reaches a given size limit, it is closed and rotated out. And a new file is opened. Successively, older files are named by adding "0", "1", etc to the base file name.
  • 2: row count based. When the log file's row count, excluding header row, reaches a given limit, the log file is closed and rotated out. And a new file is opened. Successively, older files are named by adding "0", "1", etc to the base file name.

    This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/resource/fileTimeType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Determine when the log file should be rotated:
  • 0: rolling occurs every hour.
  • 1: rolling occurs every day.
  • 2: rolling occurs every week.
  • 3: rolling occurs every month.

This configuration will be effective only when policy type is 0.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/resource/logFileName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The log file name.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/resource/maxFileRows
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum rows allowed in a log file before the file is rotated out. Row limit of 0 means the file will grow without limit.

This configuration will be effective only when policy type is 2.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/resource/maxFileSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Maximun log file size. When this limit is reached, current log file is rotated out.

If file size is set to 0, log file will grow without limit, and it will not be rotated.

This configuration will be effective only when policy type is 1.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/resource/rolloverLimit
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of log files to be kept in rotatation including the active one. When this number is reached the oldest file will be deleted on each rotation.

This configuration will be effective only when policy type is 1 or 2.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/statistics/enableLogging
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This is used to control logging outputs. Current supported levels:
  • OFF: logging to file will be turned off.
  • INFO: logging to file will be turned on.

    This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/statistics/fileRotationPolicy
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The rotation policy determines when to roll this log file which captures query statistics. Policy types:
  • 0: time based. When a certain time limit has reached, the log file is closed and rotated out. And a new file is opened. If time-base is hourly, older files are named by adding "1", "2", and all the way until "24" to the base file name. If time-base is daily, older files are named by adding "Monday" "Tuesday", and unitl "Sunday" to the base file name. If time-base is weekly, "1", "2", and until "52" are added to base file. If time-base is monthly, "January", "February", and until "December" are added to base file name.
  • 1: file size based. When the log file reaches a given size limit, it is closed and rotated out. And a new file is opened. Successively, older files are named by adding "0", "1", etc to the base file name.
  • 2: row count based. When the log file's row count, excluding header row, reaches a given limit, the log file is closed and rotated out. And a new file is opened. Successively, older files are named by adding "0", "1", etc to the base file name.

    This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/statistics/fileTimeType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Determine when the log file should be rotated:
  • 0: rolling occurs every hour.
  • 1: rolling occurs every day.
  • 2: rolling occurs every week.
  • 3: rolling occurs every month.

This configuration will be effective only when policy type is 0.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/statistics/logFileName
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The log file name.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/statistics/maxFileRows
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum rows allowed in a log file before the file is rotated out. Row limit of 0 means the file will grow without limit.

This configuration will be effective only when policy type is 2.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/statistics/maxFileSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Maximun log file size. When this limit is reached, current log file is rotated out.

If file size is set to 0, log file will grow without limit, and it will not be rotated.

This configuration will be effective only when policy type is 1.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/logging/statistics/rolloverLimit
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of log files to be kept in rotatation including the active one. When this number is reached the oldest file will be deleted on each rotation.

This configuration will be effective only when policy type is 1 or 2.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/datashipquery/maxConcurrentDataTransfers
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting sets a limit on number of concurrent data transfers used in data ship queries that the server can can perform. If this limit is reached, new queries that need to perform data transfers will block until some existing transfers complete.
Note changing this has no effect on currently running queries.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Maximum Number of Concurrent Data Transfers

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/datashipquery/mode
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Controls the behavior of queries to which data ship execution mode applies. <li>EXECUTE_FULL_SHIP_ONLY: After ship query must be pass-through. Otherwise a runtime error will be generated. <li>EXECUTE_PARTIAL_SHIP: After ship query may still be a federated query. <li>EXECUTE_ORIGINAL: If after ship query is not pass-through, execution will proceed with original 'unshipped' query plan. <li>DISABLED: Disable data ship feature.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/disableDisjunctionTransitiveRelationshipFinding
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether CIS will find transitive relationships of or/in cluases.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Disable transitive relationship finding of disjunctions

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/enableCheckForNestedAggregates
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether CIS will check if nested aggregates is supported by datasource.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Check if nested aggregates is supported by datasource

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/enableRuntimeStats
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls whether the system will record the number of rows returned when procedures are executed. The Query Engine will take runtime statistics into consideration, when they are present, to create optimized query execution plans.

When Enable Runtime Stats is set to "True" the Composite Server Query Engine will record the number of rows returned every time a procedure is executed. This applies to any kind of procedure that returns a cursor - SQL Scripts, parameterized queries, physical stored procedures, transformations, etc.

This setting has potential to improve performance for joins and unions that utilize the output of procedures. Joins that depend on procedures with a highly variable number of returned rows will benefit less.

Note: Changing the setting value will not affect queries that are currently being run.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/maxCardinalityForAutomaticSortMergeAlgorithm
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls the estimated maximum number of rows in the left or right hand side of a Join/Union to trigger an automatic sort merge join/union.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Maximum Left/Right Cardinality for Automatic Sort Merge Join/Union Selection

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/parallelUnions
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls the default threading model for Unions. Setting it to false causes Union operations to be streamed for best memory usage. Setting it to true causes Unions to use extra memory and to use threading to increase throughput.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/rewriteInSubQueriesAsJoins
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether IN Sub Queries will be rewritten using its equivalent join form. Note changing this has no effect on currently running queries.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/semijoin/maxSourceCardinality
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the estimated maximum number of rows in the source side of a join to trigger an automatic semi-join.
This value can be overridden at data source level using the Studio.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/semijoin/minTargetToSourceRatio
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This setting controls the estimated minimum ratio of target side data source cardinality to source side cardinality of a join to trigger an automatic semi-join.
For example, if this property is set to 10 and source side estimate is 75, then semi-join will be chosen if cardinality of the target of semi join is 750 or more.
This value can be overridden at data source level using the Studio.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Min Ratio of Target Cardinality to Source Cardinality

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/optimizations/useSemiJoinWhileRewritingInSubQueriesAsJoins
serverAttributeDef.annotation: This setting controls whether to use Semi Join while rewriting IN Sub Queries as joins. Note changing this has no effect on currently running queries.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Use Semi-Join While Rewriting IN Sub-Queries as Joins

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/overrides/decimalCasting3.7CompatMode
serverAttributeDef.annotation: If true, the server will push down cast operation that may cause truncation, unless strict mode is specified. The default value is false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/overrides/disableCaseSensitivityCorrection
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines whether the server corrects the SQL for case sensitivity setting mismatch. The default value is false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/overrides/disableIgnoreTrailingSpacesCorrection
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines whether the server corrects the SQL for ignore trailing spaces setting mismatch. The default value is false.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/overrides/enableExecEnvCaseSensitivityForCharFunctions
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines whether the server execution of character functions conforms to the 'Case Sensitivity' setting of the query execution environment or not. If not, functions TRIM, BTRIM, LTRIM, RTRIM, INSTR, POSITION, STRPOS and TRANSLATE will be 'Case Sensitive' when executed within CIS. The default value is True.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Character Functions Conform to Case Sensitivity Setting

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/overrides/ignoreCaseSensitivityMismatch
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines whether the server ignores case sensitivity setting differences between the server and the data source. The default value is false.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Push Even if Case Sensitivity Mismatch

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/sql/overrides/ignoreIgnoreTrailingSpacesMismatch
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines whether the server ignores trailing space setting differences between the server and the data source. The default value is false.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Push Even if Trailing Spaces Mismatch

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/baseURI
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The base URI of the target namespace of Composite Web Data Services. If unset, base URI will default to 'http://hostname/' where hostname is the fully qualified name of the host. Changing the base URI will result in regeneration of WSDL definitions for all Composite Web Data Services. It may take minutes to complete.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/acceptQueueSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Number of http/https connection requests that can be queued up before further connection requests are rejected.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/disable
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When Disable HTTP is set to false (the default value) Composite Server behaves normally and communications between Composite applications can take place over HTTP or SSL/HTTPS connections.

When Disable HTTP is set to true, the Composite Server disallows unsecured HTTP connections initiated from client applications. When HTTP is disabled Composite command line utilities must use the -encrypt option and Composite Studio users must login and use SSL over the HTTPS port. Clear text connections between the Composite Server and Composite Studio and Composite command line utilities are not allowed when Disable HTTP is set to true.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/disableOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When Disable HTTP (On Server Restart) is set to false (the default value), on Server restart, Composite Server behaves normally and communications between Composite applications can take place over HTTP or SSL/HTTPS connections.

When Disable HTTP (On Server Restart) is set to true, on Server restart, the Composite Server disallows unsecured HTTP connections initiated from client applications. When HTTP is disabled Composite command line utilities must use the -encrypt option and Composite Studio users must login and use SSL over the HTTPS port. Clear text connections between the Composite Server and Composite Studio and Composite command line utilities are not allowed on Server restart when Disable HTTP (On Server Restart) is set to true.

The Composite Server must be restarted for changes to this value to have effect. This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/headerBufferSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The size of the buffer for HTTP headers per connection. Warning: arbitrarily increasing this value may cause performance issues due to increased memory consumption.

This value does not take effect until server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/lowResourceMaxIdleTime
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum amount of time in milliseconds for an idle connection to wait for a request or read during a low resources state.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/lowResources
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The number of idle worker threads needed to not be in low resources state.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/maxIdleTime
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum amount of time in milliseconds for an idle worker thread to wait for a request or read.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/maxThreads
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of worker threads available to handle HTTP connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/minThreads
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The minimum number of worker threads available to handle HTTP connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/port
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
HTTP Port (HTTP base port) is the TCP/IP port. Web services clients (including Composite Studio) connect using this port. All other CIS ports are derived from this setting.

Derived CIS Ports:

  • HTTP base port +1 = JDBC and ODBC
  • HTTP base port +2 = HTTP SSL
  • HTTP base port +3 = JDBC SSL
  • HTTP base port +4 = Reserved
  • HTTP base port +5 = Reserved
  • HTTP base port +6 = Monitor
  • HTTP base port +7 = Active Cluster/JGroups
  • HTTP base port +8 = Repository default
  • HTTP base port +9 = Composite Monitor(reserved)


    This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/portOnServerRestart
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
HTTP Port (HTTP base port) is the TCP/IP port. Web services clients (including Composite Studio) connect using this port. All other CIS ports are derived from this setting.

Derived CIS Ports:

  • HTTP base port +1 = JDBC and ODBC
  • HTTP base port +2 = HTTP SSL
  • HTTP base port +3 = JDBC SSL
  • HTTP base port +4 = Reserved
  • HTTP base port +5 = Reserved
  • HTTP base port +6 = Monitor
  • HTTP base port +7 = Active Cluster/JGroups
  • HTTP base port +8 = Repository default
  • HTTP base port +9 = Composite Monitor(reserved)

    CAUTION: Changing the HTTP base port value also changes the value of all derived ports after the next CIS restart.

    The HTTP base port value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and it is not replicated in cluster instances.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/http/spawnOrShrinkAt
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The number of queued jobs (or idle threads) needed before the thread pool is grown (or shrunk).

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/acceptQueueSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Number of http/https connection requests that can be queued up before further connection requests are rejected.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/enabled
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Enable or disable the listener.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/headerBufferSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The size of the buffer for HTTP headers per connection. Warning: arbitrarily increasing this value may cause performance issues due to increased memory consumption.

This value does not take effect until server restart.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/lowResourceMaxIdleTime
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum amount of time in milliseconds for an idle connection to wait for a request or read during a low resources state.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/lowResources
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The number of idle worker threads needed to not be in low resources state.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/maxIdleTime
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum amount of time in milliseconds for an idle worker thread to wait for a request or read.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/maxThreads
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of worker threads available to handle Connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/minThreads
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The minimum number of worker threads available to handle Connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/port
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
TCP/IP port that Web services clients (including Studio) should connect to. This port is always set to 2 greater than the http port.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/protocol
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The transport layer security protocol.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/spawnOrShrinkAt
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The number of queued jobs (or idle threads) needed before the thread pool is grown (or shrunk)

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/https/status
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The current status of the listener.

This value is a read-only value that indicates the current server state.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/jms/keepAliveTime
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When the number of threads is greater than the minThreads, this is the maximum time (in seconds) that excess idle threads will wait for new messages before terminating.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/jms/maxThreads
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum number of worker threads available per JMS port to handle Connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/jms/minThreads
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The minimum number of worker threads available per JMS port to handle Connections.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/jms/reconnectInterval
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Time in miliseconds to retry connecting with the JMS broker.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/jms/reconnectTryCount
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The number of times the JMS connection retry is attempted before giving up.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/jms/reconnectWaitTime
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Initial delay in miliseconds before the server attempts reconnecting the JMS broker.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/communications/jms/workQueueSize
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The number of messages queued up per thread before a new thread is created for executing the work.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/digestauth/allowXWSSE
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Whether or not to process UsernameToken authentication requests embedded as X-WSSE html headers.

Changes may not take effect until the server is restarted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/digestauth/cacheNonces
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Whether to cache and detect previously used nonces. When enabled, all nonces used within the timeout window will be recorded, and any authentication request attempting to re-use a previously used nonce will be rejected. This is strongly recommended in order to prevent replay attacks.

Changes may not take effect until the server is restarted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/digestauth/hashAlgorithm
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Hash algorithm to use for computing digest. The 2004 Web Services Security standard specifies SHA-1, but stronger algorithms from the SHA-2 family (such as SHA-512) may be used an appropriate service provider is available.

Changes may not take effect until the server is restarted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/digestauth/requireCreated
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Require password digests to include creation timestamp. This is strongly recommended in order to prevent replay attacks.

Changes may not take effect until the server is restarted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/digestauth/requireNonce
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Require password digests to include nonce. This is strongly recommended in order to prevent replay attacks.

Changes may not take effect until the server is restarted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/digestauth/timeoutWindow
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The maximum time between the specified creation timestamp and the server's current time allowed before an authentication request will be rejected. Because server clocks cannot be assumed to be synchronized, this value must be treated imprecisely. Keeping this duration relatively short is important for preventing replay attacks, but the duration must not be set so short that differences in server clocks cause authentication to fail.

This value also determines the duration for which client nonces will be cached.

Changes may not take effect until the server is restarted.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/impactOnLegacy
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines any impact on the legacy web service during startup.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/logging
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Determines whether the server logs request and response messages for Composite Web data services. If enabled, the request and response messages will be logged into files in the server's log directory.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/pipedbuffersize
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The piped stream buffer size for soap or rest message encoder.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/stripTrailingZeros
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Instructs the server to strip trailing zeros in decimal values when possible.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/timezoneBaseOnGMT
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Results from web services are labeled with a timestamp on receipt. By default the Composite Server is set to use a timestamp based on the GMT time zone. When changed to "false", results from soap response will be marked with a local time based timestamp

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/validation/validateRequests
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When set to true, response validation requires that Web service response messages comply with their XML schema. Schema validation may help debug message interactions with client applications.

Note: When response validation is turned on, the Composite Server can fail to validate some internal entities causing Studio to fail at login if the connection is inhibited by a firewall or disabled network. If the cs_studio.log returns internal server errors encountered while parsing the XML schema then the response validation should be set back to false to lift the burden of the message validation for debugging.

serverAttributeDef.name: /server/webservices/validation/validateResponses
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Indicate whether or not Web service response messages will be validated against their XML schema. Schema validation may help debug interaction with client applications.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/connectionPoolCheckoutTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
This timeout controls how long the server should wait to checkout a connection from a data source connection pool. If the timeout is 0, the server will wait until it obtains a connection from the pool.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Data Source Connection Pool Checkout Timeout

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/dataship/bufferFlushThreshold
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Certain types of data ship SQL executions might buffer very large tables before delivery to the data ship target. This configuration parameter can be used to limit the size of the buffer. The buffer is flushed when this limit is reached.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Buffer Flush Threshold. The minimum value is 1000.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/dataship/columnDelimiter
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The column delimiter character to be used while exporting/importing the contents to/from a flat file. For an invalid column delimiter it defaults to '|'.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/dataship/escapeChar
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The escape character to be used while exporting/importing the contents to/from a flat file. It defaults to '\'.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/dataship/rowDelimiter
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The row delimiter character to be used while exporting/importing the contents to/from a flat file. For an invalid row delimiter it defaults to '\n'.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/defaultCommitRowLimit
serverAttributeDef.annotation: When a cache to database table is processing, this value specifies a row count for a commit to occur while inserting cache data. The transaction will be committed every time after the number of rows that the cache data is inserted has reached this limit.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/defaultExecutionTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation: Sets the number of seconds the data source will wait for an execution to occur. If the limit is exceeded, a timeout will occur. If this value is zero, it means there is no limit. If it is greater than 0, the execution will wait at most the given number of seconds.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/delayedConnectionCommitRollbackTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When the Composite Server is asked to rollback or commit a JDBC connection on a data source, it will wait until all the result sets are closed. This timeout controls how long the server will wait. After the timeout, if there are still open result sets, the connection is forcibly closed.

If the timeout value is 0, the server will not timeout.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/delayedStatementCloseTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
When a thread is blocked in a JDBC driver, either trying to execute a query or read rows, the Composite Server avoid calling ResultSet.close() or Statement.close() on the driver. The server will wait until all threads are out of the driver before calling close() (the client call that initiated the close is not blocked). The reason it does this is to avoid mulit-threaded issues with JDBC drivers.

This timeout controls how long the server should wait until it forcibly calls ResultSet.close() or Statement.close(). If the timeout is 0, the server will never forcibly call close.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/enableConnectionPoolCheckoutTimeout
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
if true, global data source connection pool checkout timeout is used by the server. This timeout controls how long the server should wait to checkout a connection from a data source connection pool. If the timeout is 0, the server will wait until it obtains a connection from the pool.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Enable Data Source Connection Pool Checkout Timeout

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/introspectableIdCacheExpirationPeriod
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The introspectable resource id cache (on a per-user, per-data source basis) will be deletd after not being accessed for this many days.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Introspectable Resource Id Cache Expiration Period

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/introspectableIdCachePurgeFrequency
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The frequency that the introspectable resource id cache will be purged of expired entries.
serverAttributeDef.displayName: Introspectable Resource Id Cache Purge Frequency

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/introspectionFullReportThreshold
serverAttributeDef.annotation: The maximum size a full introspection report can be before filtering out messages that are not warnings or errors. If the full report size is less than or equal to this value, then nothing will be filtered. Otherwise, the report will only contain a list of the resources affected by the introspection and any warnings or errors that were generated. Note that the resulting report can still end up being larger than the specified threshold even with message filtering if there are a large number of resources involved in the introspection.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/common/traceLevel
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
Log Functionality.

0 - No Log

1 - Connection

2 - Requests

3 - Data

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/enableClientAuthentication
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
If true, X.509 client certificate authentication (i.e. mutual authentication) is enabled for SSL authentication.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/keystoreKeyAlias
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The alias name of the key entry (i.e public certificate) used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients.This value is optional; if a value is set, then the key entry corresponding to the provided alias will be used for client authentication regardless of the contents of the foreign server's truststore or the results of any security callbacks.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/keystoreLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the keystore file used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients. The keystore file must contain exactly one key entry (i.e. private key/certificate pair). It may also contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/keystorePassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the keystore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the keystore file must use the same password as the file itself.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/keystoreType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the keystore file. It must be a valid keystore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/strongKeystoreKeyAlias
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The alias name of the key entry (i.e public certificate) used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients. This value is optional; if a value is set, then the key entry corresponding to the provided alias will be used for client authentication regardless of the contents of the foreign server's truststore or the results of any security callbacks.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/strongKeystoreLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the keystore file used in SSL authentication to establish the identity of the server to external clients. The keystore file must contain exactly one key entry (i.e. private key/certificate pair). It may also contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/strongKeystorePassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the keystore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the keystore file must use the same password as the file itself.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/strongKeystoreType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the keystore file. It must be a valid keystore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/strongTruststoreLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the truststore file used in SSL authentication to decide what external clients the server should trust. The truststore file can contain contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/strongTruststorePassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the truststore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the truststore file must use the same password as the file itself.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/strongTruststoreType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The type of the truststore file. It must be a valid truststore type such as "JKS" or "PKCS12".

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/truststoreLocation
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The location of the truststore file used in SSL authentication to decide what external clients the server should trust. The truststore file can contain contain zero or more trusted certificate entries from trusted certificate authorities that are used to validate the certificates that are presented by external clients.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/truststorePassword
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
The password of the truststore file and the entries within it. All password protected entries in the truststore file must use the same password as the file itself.

This value is locally defined. It will not be altered when restoring a backup and will not be replicated in a cluster.

serverAttributeDef.name: /sources/communications/truststoreType
serverAttributeDef.annotation:
